title: missing patch for gcc@7.4.0
body:
Fresh install of spack onto cent7. When installing gcc/7.4.0 indicates missing patch for m4 package:

```
[root@optane01 spack]# spack install gcc@7.4.0%gcc@4.8.5
==> libsigsegv is already installed in /mnt/ssd/spack/opt/spack/linux-centos7-x86_64/gcc-4.8.5/libsigsegv-2.11-qpmaxx6z62df4s4hwyehdwptv6kmrfhf
==> Installing m4
==> Searching for binary cache of m4
==> Warning: No Spack mirrors are currently configured
==> No binary for m4 found: installing from source
==> Warning: A dependency has updated CPATH, this may lead pkg-config to assume that the package is part of the system includes and omit it when invoked with '--cflags'.
==> Using cached archive: /mnt/ssd/spack/var/spack/cache/m4/m4-1.4.18.tar.gz
==> Using cached archive: /mnt/ssd/spack/var/spack/cache/m4/m4-1.4.18-glibc-change-work-around.patch
==> Staging archive: /mnt/ssd/spack/var/spack/stage/m4-1.4.18-hhsvnbbpgbjmyko773df2mzmp5knybru/m4-1.4.18.tar.gz
==> Created stage in /mnt/ssd/spack/var/spack/stage/m4-1.4.18-hhsvnbbpgbjmyko773df2mzmp5knybru
==> Error: spack requires 'patch'. Make sure it is in your path.
==> Error: SystemExit: 1

/mnt/ssd/spack/lib/spack/spack/package.py:1035, in do_patch:
       1032            except spack.error.SpackError:
       1033                # Touch bad file if anything goes wrong.
       1034                tty.msg('Patch %s failed.' % patch.path_or_url)
  >>   1035                touch(bad_file)
       1036                raise
       1037
       1038        if has_patch_fun:

 


```
